Package com.metal.kit.vapor.Manager

Class CharacterTextureManager

java.lang.Object
com.metal.kit.vapor.Manager.CharacterTextureManager
public class CharacterTextureManager extends Object
The manager responsible for handling character textures and animations. This class loads sprite sheets for the character's running and idle animations, splits them into individual frames, and creates corresponding Animation objects.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    CharacterTextureManager(String texturePathRun, String texturePathIdle, int nbOfFrames)
    Constructor to initialize the CharacterTextureManager by loading sprite sheets for the character's running and idle animations.

  • Constructor Details

    • CharacterTextureManager

      public CharacterTextureManager(String texturePathRun, String texturePathIdle, int nbOfFrames)
      Constructor to initialize the CharacterTextureManager by loading sprite sheets for the character's running and idle animations. The sprite sheets are split into frames, and animations are created from those frames.
      Parameters:
      texturePathRun - The path to the sprite sheet for the running animation.
      texturePathIdle - The path to the sprite sheet for the idle animation.
      nbOfFrames - The number of frames in each animation (both running and idle).

  • Method Details

    • getRunAnimation

      public com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.Animation<com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.TextureRegion> getRunAnimation()
      Returns the running animation for the character.
      Returns:
      The Animation representing the character's running animation.

    • getIdleAnimation

      public com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.Animation<com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.TextureRegion> getIdleAnimation()
      Returns the idle animation for the character.
      Returns:
      The Animation representing the character's idle animation.

    • dispose

      public void dispose()
      Disposes of the resources used by the texture sheets. This method should be called when the textures are no longer needed to free up memory.
